context: The Estonian word 'kummaline' is an adjective that describes something as strange, odd, peculiar, unusual, or curious. It can refer to physical appearance (shape, color), sensory experiences (sound, smell), phenomena, feelings, or situations that evoke surprise, curiosity, or a sense of the extraordinary. The word has various forms including 'kummalise' (genitive case) and 'kummalist' (partitive case), which are commonly used in Estonian grammar.
